get the feature labels from a dfm

Get the features from a document-feature matrix, which are stored as the column names of the dfm object.

featnames(x)

Arguments

x

the dfm whose features will be extracted

Value

character vector of the features

Examples

inaugDfm <- dfm(data_corpus_inaugural, verbose = FALSE)

# first 50 features (in original text order)
head(featnames(inaugDfm), 50)
#>  [1] "fellow"          "-"               "citizens"        "of"             
#>  [5] "the"             "senate"          "and"             "house"          
#>  [9] "representatives" ":"               "among"           "vicissitudes"   
#> [13] "incident"        "to"              "life"            "no"             
#> [17] "event"           "could"           "have"            "filled"         
#> [21] "me"              "with"            "greater"         "anxieties"      
#> [25] "than"            "that"            "which"           "notification"   
#> [29] "was"             "transmitted"     "by"              "your"           
#> [33] "order"           ","               "received"        "on"             
#> [37] "14th"            "day"             "present"         "month"          
#> [41] "."               "one"             "hand"            "i"              
#> [45] "summoned"        "my"              "country"         "whose"          
#> [49] "voice"           "can"            

# first 50 features alphabetically
head(sort(featnames(inaugDfm)), 50)
#>  [1] "-"           ","           ";"           ":"           "!"          
#>  [6] "?"           "."           "'"           "\""          "("          
#> [11] ")"           "["           "]"           "\\"          ">"          
#> [16] "$"           "1"           "1,000"       "100"         "100,000,000"
#> [21] "120,000,000" "125"         "13"          "14th"        "15th"       
#> [26] "16"          "1774"        "1776"        "1778"        "1780"       
#> [31] "1787"        "1789"        "1790"        "1800"        "1801"       
#> [36] "1812"        "1815"        "1816"        "1817"        "1818"       
#> [41] "1826"        "1850"        "1861"        "1868"        "1873"       
#> [46] "1880"        "1886"        "1890"        "1893"        "1896"       

# contrast with descending total frequency order from topfeatures()
names(topfeatures(inaugDfm, 50))
#> Error in get(".SigLength", envir = env): object '.SigLength' not found
